alert.note: Alert for Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 9:46PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickinson, western Geary, Riley, Clay, eastern Washington and Marshall Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 944 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west southwest of Marysville to 3 miles south of Salina. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Junction City, Abilene, Clay Center, Marysville, Herington, Blue Rapids, Chapman, Solomon, Wakefield, Riley, Enterprise, Frankfort, Hanover, Waterville, Milford, Leonardville, Hope, Greenleaf, Beattie and Morganville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 267 and 296. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding of water on roads. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central, north central, northeastern and east central Kansas.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Dickinson; Geary; Marshall; Riley; Washington
